strengths: Proficient in algebraic manipulation and solving linear equations
Understands ratios, proportions, and percentages well
Able to apply mathematical concepts to real-world scenarios
Comfortable working with graphical representations of functions
challenges: Struggles with abstract reasoning in higher-level algebraic problems
Difficulty recognizing problem structures that require quadratic or exponential reasoning
Needs improvement in precision when setting up word problem equations
Tends to second-guess answers, leading to slower problem-solving times

learning_preferences: Learns well from worked examples and step-by-step breakdowns
Finds peer discussions helpful for reinforcing problem-solving methods
problem_solving_approach: Breaks problems into steps but sometimes skips verification
Prefers checking solutions against multiple approaches when unsure
Can struggle with test-taking strategies under time constraints

motivators: Interested in real-world applications, particularly in science and technology
Enjoys interactive problem-solving rather than rote practice
Responds well to goal-setting and challenge-based learning
demotivators: Frustrated by problems that seem disconnected from practical use
Loses interest when explanations feel overly procedural without reasoning
Dislikes excessive repetition without variation in problem types

notes: Jordan benefits from applying algebra in real-world contexts like physics or finance.
Encouraging self-explanation strategies helps Jordan solidify understanding.
Using visual representations (graphs, tables) supports Jordanâ€™s comprehension of abstract concepts.
